There were jokes and nods to the previous Deadpool character to feature a the below par "X-Men Origins - Wolverine" movie like the action figure and the suggestion of sewing Wilson's mouth shut; a "Green Lantern" (another role played by Reynolds) card was seen and Wilson even begs not to get a green or animated suit while being treated by the Weapon X programme; talking to the camera DeadPool refers to the previous X-Men films and asks Colossus if Stewart or McAvoy was the current professor at the institute; and at one point the merc even breaks the 16th wall by talking to the audience in a flashback already talking to the audience - typical DeadPool insanity. If you are familiar with DeadPool you'll already be aware of him constantly breaking the 4th wall, and you'll no doubt be aware that he got his "Merc with a Mouth" nickname due to his constant talking and wise cracking. The film portrays that really well without ever getting confusing or boring. Sometimes the joke may not land but that's OK, it's DeadPool and he can't help himself. The minor negatives in the film for me, and let me be clear, these are teeny tiny negatives and didn't ruin the film for me; were Colossus and Ajax. I could have happily seen a different X-Man rather than the metal Russian. I imagine the CGI to create Colossus wasn't easy and maybe a simpler character could have fitted the film better - although the 'fight' scene with DeadPool on the bridge was really amusing. Ajax was a little forgettable and judging by the villains that DeadPool has fought in the comic's film-makers could have opted for somebody else - but then it wouldn't necessarily be an origins based film.

I enjoyed this although I didn't think the film was as bat sh*t crazy as it could have been, it actually had as much of a heart as it did blood shed. I enjoyed it more than other movies in the Marvel Universe. The film doesn't take itself seriously and in doing so has a great mix of emotions at different times. Combine that with great action and you have a top notch film that's well worthy of a 9 out of 10 from me. I was more content than I thought I would be being an established fan and an over critical one at that. If you want a crude rude hard paced film with lots of bloodshed action but with a soft romantic side step up and buy a ticket. In fact buy two or three tickets to help fund a follow up movie which might have Cable and or Nick Fury in it!!!

title: Deadpool has Arrived !!
review: The most anticipated movie of 2016 has arrived and I was much eager like the other audiences to go for it. I watched the movie in Imax as I had high hopes with it. The movie was astonishing with a tangled love story and a revenge saga. Deadpool was intense, funny, violent enough to make the audiences go for it. A well made story and good character played by Ryan Reynolds. Deadpool brings Reynolds back again after a series of failures. Action were timed very well and jokes in between the scenes were funny too. I got what I expected from Deadpool and Marvels continues to surprise with new projects. I go with 4/5 for 'Deadpool' and everyone should enjoy their Valentines Day watching 'DEADPOOL'.

title: Finally Marvel are going in the right direction at least with DEADPOOL anyway.
review:
So finally seen the movie i have been waiting ages to see i was first was introduced to Deadpool around 4 or 5 years ago by my older brother I read a few comics over the years and i was hooked and he is my second favourite marvel hero first being Wolverine but I will say that in movie form Deadpool comes first he would probably say that to ha ha.

On to the movie I found it very well executed I loved the opening credits simply because it's all about tongue and cheek and not taking it seriously the action sequences were really great to watch really over the top same goes for the jokes I couldn't stop laughing the bit with the hand growing back had me nearly in tears with laughter and the ORGINS WOLVERINE toy was a nice touch.

I will say though that the story was a bit lacking and the villain was done poorly but not to enough to spoil the movie.

The introduction of Colossus and warhead was great I liked the new version of Colossus really looks from the comics

I would say this anyone who does not know the character and wants to see this movie go and research on him and then see how you feel about going to see the movie and always go with an open mind.

title: This is Gonna Be One Twisted Valentine's Day Gift
review: Confession: I have a very limited comic book experience. I just learn about these Marvel or D.C. characters from either my 17-year-old uncle or my knowledge from traditional comic-book movies and animated T.V. shows. The best comic-book movies I always connected with the most are the X-Men saga. I've been a fan ever since the first movie directed by Bryan Singer came out 16 years ago. (Currently waiting for "X-Men: Apocalypse" to come out this Memorial Day.) But this is quite new to me when I heard that there is a "Deadpool" movie actually happening. Last time I heard about "Deadpool", I first saw him in "X-Men Origins: Wolverine", which I liked but it was the rotten apple of the series. He was, of course, played by Ryan Reynolds, who made the most of his very small role until... (see the movie or not and see why all of us were so disappointed.) Anyway, me being the reluctant one, I didn't think a "Deadpool" movie would work. Guess what, it's the one all of us comic- book or non-comic-book nerds are waiting for. So why did I warm up to "Deadpool"? Well, for one thing, this guy who dresses up in a red suit is the kind of hero we haven't seen in a while. A man who shoots first and says a few wise-ass things after that. He's also known to break all types of walls (first, second, third, fourth and I'm pretty sure there's a fifth one) and he doesn't give a *bleep* about everything. As played by Reynolds, he seems to be the perfect choice for an R-rated and unbelievably unconventional Marvel character. So, how does this movie work? Well, it starts off with the ridiculously inventive opening titles done in Deadpool's way plus a killer action sequence on a highway. Then it's the origin story of "Deadpool" which is quite a surprising one. We get to meet Wade T. Wilson (Reynolds), also known as "The Merc with the Mouth" and maximum brute force. He also finds his "Pretty Woman" (see what I did there?) in Vanessa (Morena Baccarin from "Spy", "Gotham" and "Homeland"). There is a massive flaw in this system, in which he has cancer. Making sure he doesn't lose her, he signs for a experiment that should help him be cured of cancer. Turns out poor Wade made a deal with the devil, or in this case, Ajax (a stunning Ed Skrein who is obviously a doppelganger for Nicholas Hoult, also known as "Beast" from the "X-Men" series) for an experiment that goes horribly wrong leaving his whole body scarred. Now, all Wade needs to do is get revenge on Ajax and once he puts on the Deadpool outfit, it's all good to go. But standing in his way though are two members of the X-Men: Colossus (Stefan Kapicic) and Negasonic Teenage Warhead (feisty Brianna Hildebrand). "Deadpool" is (and has to be) the best R- Rated unconventional superhero movie of its kind since the original "Kick-Ass". It has the right to make fun of the superhero genre and be super cheeky, clever, dark, funny and incredibly bloody. It even wears its heart and the R-Rating on its sleeve, for example, there's a sex scene with Deadpool and Vanessa, set to Neil Sedaka's "Calendar Girl" that pushes the boundaries to anything I've ever seen. Plus, the bone- breaking, blood-spurting action is about as inventive as one could possibly ask for. Plus, Deadpool also has a tendency to talk smack about everything from the studio that's releasing the film to the X-Men to Wolverine and the actor playing him and even the actor that's playing Deadpool. Although I wasn't a fan of "Van Wilder" and I only warmed to him when he was in great movies like "Definitely, Maybe", "The Proposal", "Smokin' Aces" and "The Change-Up", I like Ryan Reynolds and he's very good here. Scratch the "very good", he's electric in the role of Deadpool. His foul-mouthed, fast-paced and earnest deliveries of certain lines are sure to be quite memorable. And even though there are times when we just want him to shut up, you can't put him down because we like Deadpool and we certainly want him to get the girl. He's also helped by a really cool cast including Morena Baccarin who provides the heart and soul of gold in the love story part, T.J. Miller, who I also like, is pitch-perfect as "the comic relief" (in Deadpool's terms, not mine) Weasel, Leslie Uggams as Uncle Al, who is wise, blind and caring (not in the traditional sense) and M.M.A fighter turned movie star Gina Carano is lethally badass as Angel Dust, who is more stronger than Mr. Pool and Colossus all combined. Props has to go to first-time director Tim Miller (from the world of visual effects) and screenwriters Rhett Reese & Paul Wernick of "Zombieland" for letting this animal go loose in wild, big and cool ways that breaks the usual types of stuff we usually see in most superhero movies and for giving Reynolds an opportunity to get comically crazy and go out blazing with a high chord, like he always does. Deadpool is actually the first movie of 2016 that unabashedly lives up to the hype, mainly because we weren't expecting something quite like this. I don't know if we will have something like this again, but hey, at least it was awesome, right? You'll have a blast, trust me and bring some chimichangas while you're at it. It's the perfect and most twisted Valentine's Day gift you'll give to your significant other. Oh, and one more thing, this movie is not for the faint of heart, the squeamish and certainly not for kids.

title: A Super Hero like we've never seen before.
review:
An R rated super hero movie. Our prayers have been answered.

That is because the people at 20th Century Fox, home of the X-Men franchise, have decided to kick things up a notch and then kick them sideways. In the process, they've given us a super hero movie heavy with violence, very, very, vulgar language and sexual situations. In short, every thing the Spider Man movies were not.

We get a movie with attitude to spare, right from the opening credits, which is a joke too good to spoil. Give the writers, Rob Liefield and Fabian Nicieza, along with director Tim Miller great credit; they get the Marvel character of Deadpool right and then some, perfectly capturing the Merc with the Mouth we've all come to know in the comic book. One the best things about this movie as that it does not try and do too much, giving a compact origin and revenge story without shoehorning in too many other Marvel Universe characters from the X-Men books. Unlike Spidey, Superman and Batman, Deadpool does not have a legendary origin story for screenwriters ruin by tweaking it for the big screen. We just get douche bag Wade Wilson diagnosed with terminal cancer and then mutated by risky "treatment" run by Ajax (aka Francis), the villain of the piece whose only motive is to create super powered slaves. Wade, his body now a mass of scare tissue courtesy of Ajax, fashions the now familiar red spandex costume, adopts the name Deadpool, and goes to get some payback. A simple plot that makes sense, unlike some other comic book franchises that believe big is better.

DEADPOOL finally gives Ryan Reynolds a part truly equal to his talent, and should make him the super star he should have become a decade ago. He's been a dependable actor in rom-coms and bad comedies, while often proving himself a very capable action hero. Deadpool is makes good use of his physical attributes and great comic timing; the jokes and one liners he gets off are funny enough on the page, but coming out of Reynolds mouth is what really makes them funny. And proving he is a very good sport, the script takes very funny pokes at GREEN LANTERN and BLADE II.

There is a good supporting cast, starting with TJ Miller, whose character should simply be called Comic Relief. Ed Skrein makes for a good bad guy with requisite British accent. Morina Baccarin is Wade's tough talking girlfriend, a love interest most worthy of the hero. Stefan Kapicic is the Colossus we've known from the X-books, while Briana Hildenbrandt is his sidekick, Teenage Nagasonic Warhead. Leslie Uggams turns up in a small, but very funny, part as the blind woman Deadpool rooms with a one point. Karin Soni is quite funny as cabbie who chauffeurs heroes to a couple of big showdowns. Stan Lee has his gratuitous cameo, but it really is one of the funnier ones-the man is a great sport.

The violence is bloody, and the there is a car chase that doesn't look like every one we've ever seen in a movie before. Many of the jokes are very dirty and in really bad taste-way beyond anything heard on Family Guy. Some of them will make you laugh just because of how awful they are-nobody who sees this movie will never again not giggle at the mention of Meredith Baxter Birney.

And there is a great soundtrack featuring Chicago and Neil Sedaka among others.

Though this is a super hero movie, it's not one for the kids, and its raunchy attitude breaks new ground for the super hero genre. Let's hope the guys over at Disney/Marvel are paying attention.

title: A Welcome Change.
review: As a loyal comic book fan I found this a pleasant change from all the recent pg kiddie films. The action scenes are spectacular. The humor is adult and mature. Visuals are also stunning and good for its budget.Deadpool is at his best. That being said Deadpool certainly sets the bar higher for future comic book films. The character is fully utilized and is a direct translation from his comic book counter part.Ryan Reynolds does a superb job as the "merc" with a mouth and delivers on all aspects! Watch out Avengers there's a new hero in town and he ain't playing! A must watch for any person who wants a dark mature comic book hero.

title: The Merc with a Mouth Finally Opened His Mouth
review:
Deadpool is a movie directed by Tim Miller and written by Rhett Reese and Paul Wernick. It stars Ryan Reynolds, Ed Skrein, Morena Baccarin, and T.J. Miller along with Karan Soni, Brianna Hildebrand, and Stefan Kapicic.

A former Special Forces operative turned mercenary is subjected to a rogue experiment that leaves him with accelerated healing powers, adopting the alter ego Deadpool.

I didn't like Deadpool. I didn't love Deadpool. I adored Deadpool. To me Deadpool is the height of Marvel entertainment as it keeps the essence of the iconic character while weaving together a thoroughly engrossing story.

This movie's story has everything needed to build a pop cultural masterwork. It finds its heart and originality in in its vulgarity and hubris, much like its main character. This sets it apart from any other superhuman movie ever movie, at least in my opinion. This is thanks in large part to the snark and acid wit demonstrated by the writers or "the true heroes of this story."

Though decidedly scatter-shot and a tad bit convoluted, Deadpool's writers over come these minor hiccups with mighty style, showcasing their ferocious flair. Ready and willing to please, these two fine men manage craft a movie that has both humor and depth. A feat like no other.

Though the wit, self reference, genre subversion, and fourth wall breaks demonstrated in this movie did impress me, the one facet that really sealed the deal, as Wade would say (perhaps in a different context), for me was the love story. In most if not all action/comedies there is a romance. In most if not all action/comedies the romance falls flat and seems overly clichéd. This is not the case as Vanessa and Wade's romance feels earned, thoroughly sweet, and really fleshes out the characters, leading to some seriously tense and emotional scenes in a movie that utilizes the phrase, "less angry Rosie O'Donnell."

The credibility of the love story and the nonstop humor behind it is only furthered by the two dedicated performers, Ryan Reynolds and Morena Baccarin, who display their seamless chemistry 'marvelously.'

Another attribute that seemed thoroughly seamless was the pace of this movie. Constantly speeding but never exhausting, Tim Miller, manages to create perfect shot after perfect shot. Never overusing certain techniques and avoiding altogether dreadful uses of shaky cam and other equally annoying and lazy techniques first time directors often use, Tim Miller proved to filmgoers everywhere that he has a long and prolific career ahead of him.

Through this movie, Ryan Reynolds has finally proved that, he too, has a long and prolific career ahead of him. Dawning the challenging role of the iconic and universally loved Deadpool, Reynolds offers his best work to date, bringing his trademark charm and enthusiasm to the profane 'Merc with a Mouth.' He is truly the shining star of this glimmering mess. He played the role so well I really can't think of anyone else to play the part, a feat only previously achieved by a handful of talented actors. He fit so snugly into the part that I can really see a possible Globe win for him in the already planned sequel.

Accompanying Reynolds, Morena Baccarin delivers a surprisingly heartfelt turn as Wade's love interest, Vanessa. Far from elementary, Baccarin brings out the complex emotional states of her character and Reynolds'. Ed Skrein was really the only wild card in the lot as I wasn't sure how original they could make the 'Evil British Villain' cliché. Luckily for the Transporter:Refueled star, he was given a genuinely decent role as the perpetual thorn in our outlandish hero's side.

Overall I can confidently say that Deadpool has quickly become my second favorite comic book ever made, barely lacking behind The Dark Knight. Deadpool Gets an A+ or a 10/10

title: A new superhero of sorts
review: When watching Deadpool. It is not exactly the typical marvel movie since it had lots if cursing, blood, fourth wall references, and nudity which doesn't really bother me but it feels different. Ryan Reynolds returns as the chatter box wade Wilson who manages to charm himself with his witty humor and given the chance to explore hid origins. Wade is a mercenary that falls in love with a hooked named Vanessa but finds out the tragic news that he has cancer and goes to Francis as a way of fibbing a cure for his illness. While he does findeed a cure for his condition but it also mutates him. One of the aspects I liked was giving colissus a decent role who has been underused in the x men films

title: Amazing movie
review: By far the hardest that I've ever laughed in a theatre. The movie does have a weak plot and the villains could be better, but that doesn't affect my rating much because the movie made up for it by doing everything that they did do perfectly. I give it a 9.7/10 but I'll just round it up to 10. I highly recommend the movie, but you probably won't like it if you are sensitive to violence . I Also would not recommend it to children, although it was not as vulgar as a film as I anticipated,it is still definitely for an adult audience. Everyone in my theatre applauded the film afterwards, including me. I'm just rambling because I loved this movie so much, but I should probably sum things up. It was hilarious, action packed, fun, and without a doubt Deadpool

title: Trying too hard to be funny, and failed big time.
review:
This movie reminds me of "A Million Ways to Die in the West", which also fails to be funny but in a different way. In "Deadpool", their only way of being funny is to throw lame, contextless, jokes one after another. Watching the movie is like watching a standup comedian show, a talentless one of course.

The action part of this movie fails also. Lots of action and violence, but none of them enjoyable. It is so messy and chaotic that it is as if the action scenes are not be directed at all, and the actors just improvise with minimum effort.

Awful, just awful.

title: Really?
review: Rating 8 out of 10? Spending 58 mil and reaping 363 mil? No wonder this country voted for a clown to be their president (and this clown got a circus as a government to run this decadent society). We can tell about a nation and its people by their cultural icons such as music, movies, arts, etc. Hollywood keeps on making these brain-dead violent blockbusters because of the herd mentality of this dumb-down general population. Same trend in the music industry...

title: Now this is what a superhero movie should be!
review: Superb Movie. Must watch. This is what a superhero should be. Fun is from start till the end. Ryan Reynolds is at his best. Morena does great job too. Direction was terrific but the story was not at its best. Right from the start when Deadpool introduces us to what is there to see in the movie, leading to an awesome and one of the best action sequence I have seen in the movie. His punching dialogues and high octane action is the real hero in this movie. The movie delivers what was promised. There is action, there is love, there is revenge, there is emotions. Honestly, I had never heard of Deadpool before I saw this movie. After seeing it, I had to find out more about him as I loved him. Now I can't wait to see a sequel...

title: Perpetual death-drive's the allure
review:
I guess the reason it's so easy to divinate Deadpool is that his self- destruction, the normal humans' death-drive alike (as explained by psychoanalysis) actually drives him toward greatness, immortality even - this is what we're often driven to believe in our lives as well (besides immortality, guys, I hope no one is so naive).

Only when reality kicks in, we tend to stop, regain control, get back to our terms, realize that these self-destructive processes we put ourselves through as coping mechanisms might actually lead to perishing of our existence. On the most basic level, who doesn't like to get trashed of alcohol on a Saturday night for that matter?

This is where Deadpools' humor kicks in as another tool of success for this impeccable story, to help us cope with the inabilities that we face and fail to overcome, especially psychologically. Well not exactly the same inabilities, but hey, Deadpool might be immortal now but his face's ugly as life that he now has to live forever, so we ain't the only ones with problems.

Very captivating film without this pretentious effort of other superhero movies, but still full of glittery artifice and shinny CGI. No wonder a lot of people might be hardly waiting for the second part, and who knows how many more.

title: Watch this on the toilet
review: Confusing title - I know, but I peed my pants laughing so hard that I felt like I should've watched it whilst sitting on the toilet. Normally what one can expect from a movie is a shitty love story (because that's what people like apparently), a "happy ending", and some kind of evil villain who will ultimately be destroyed or whatever, and of course lots of action and killing. This movie combined all those annoying features into the most genius, innovative, and eye-opening movie of all times. For once we, as watchers, are presented with a righteous killer (you know it's true) on a path of legit destruction who is not afraid of spilling blood, ridiculing everything and everyone whenever he can (kudos to Ryan Reynolds) and wherever he can. Bravo, Marvel, for making 2016 just a slightly bit better.

title: My guilty pleasure of 2016
review: There is always a guilty pleasure film every year that creeps into my favourites and in 2016 it is no other than Deadpool which takes the comic hero genre to another level of funny where even the Guardians of the Galaxy could not reach. This one is not about the action scenes (which there were in good doses of) or even gory ones (which there were plenty of), but more so about the little details of an excellent score including music from Wham!, the amazing funny and borderline rude one liners including a ton of in-movie jokes and in general the entire self-sarcastic nature of it. In fact, and regardless of the admittedly very thin plot, it was so much fun that I had to watch it twice.

title: A must see
review:
Deadpool is a must see movie.

Ryan Reynolds was brilliant throughout. If you are looking for action, humour and some good music this movie has it all.

There was never a dull moment and the superb writing and production combined with Reynold's timing and delivery made for many moments of really laughing out loud.

This movie doesn't take the same serious approach as other super hero action movies, the central character is refreshingly flawed and likable for it, the movie was very well made on all levels its production values are as good as any of the blockbuster movies out there.

I was totally entertained from start to finish.

title: Bloody hilarious! (REVIEW FOR NON-COMIC BOOK FANS!!!!)
review:
Once upon a time there was a film studio that was living a dream. Every film they came out with was a major superhero blockbuster. Everybody loved their films. But there comes a time when things begin to saturate. A time when glories of the past are casting a shadow upon everything the future will bring. Yes, Marvel Cinematic Universe, I'm talking about you. We're getting tired of the endless machine invasions that may cause the end of the world. We're sick of the superheroes that are trying to break the status quo. And then, they reinvented themselves. They regained our attention. They brought us Deadpool.

Deadpool (Ryan Reynolds) is the alter ego of Wade Wilson, a former Special Forces operative. Wade got involved in a rogue experiment that gave him accelerated healing powers. This might seem great, but he had to pay a price. His skin transformed into scar tissue and to be honest, it doesn't look really nice. So, Wade Wilson starts his journey of vengeance to find Ajax (Ed Skrein), the man who did this to him so he can finally come back to his beloved girlfriend Vanessa (Morena Baccarin). The title may ring a bell. We've already met the antihero Deadpool in one of Marvel's many franchises: the X-men. Yet, we need to forget all we learned about Deadpool in X-men Origins: Wolverine (2009). The "old" Deadpool is nothing in comparison with the "new" one. New Deadpool isn't only as bloody as his former self, but on top of that: he is bloody hilarious!

You could think that it's easy for Marvel: "Hey! We're going to make a new franchise out of an old one! Just take some characters from the other film, write a sequel story, steal some ideas from the comic books and we're done!" But no, they didn't. Tehy brought up a lot of new stuff, things we hadn't already seen in the comics. The writers gave us an R-rated film, made of a violent and unflinching action sequences, packed with crude and twisted humor, with a lovely romantic touch. And just to give it an extra dimension, the whole film feels like Wade Wilson has written and directed it himself (this is very comic accurate).

That's where the main characteristic of Deadpool comes up. His favorite hobby is breaking the 'fourth wall'. While watching the film, you can catch yourself thinking about certain aspects of the film and then, all of a sudden, he turns his head, looks into the camera and joins you on that train of thoughts. Another fourth wall breaking-aspect, Deadpool knows that he is in a film. He knows that Ryan Reynolds is doing a very good job in putting his character down. This results in many references to other Marvel films, the actor's previous achievements in other films and the acting skills of himself and his co-stars. You could say that Deadpool is almost reaching perfection. The only thing that keeps it away from it, is at the same time the thing that makes it so good: the humor. The many unpredictable jokes become rather predictable once you're halfway through the film. The once surprising effect gets lost.

I'd say that if you're still doubting about seeing this film: don't! It's really worth it. It's refreshing, fun to watch, hilarious, sometimes touching and contains a lot of exciting action shots. It also features two of Wade Wilson's colleague's among the X-men: Colossus (Stefan Kapicic) and Negasonic Teenage Warhead (Brianna Hildebrand). And as Deadpool would say while pointing a gun at your face: "What are you still doing here, huh? Get the hell out of here and go watch the movie! Do we have deal, huh?"

title: A very fun, rewatchable, hilarious film!
review: Deadpool is a great movie. The movie is very funny and entertaining and the action is AMAZING! However, the film is not perfect. I have a couple of issues with it. SOMETIMES the cussing and dirty jokes can get tiresome or too much, however it only got on my nerves once or twice during the film, so it was not too much of an issue. My only "issue" with the film is the origin. While many of the origin parts are very entertaining, once he gets to the place where he gets his powers I became very bored and was ready for it to return to the Deadpool scenes. However, I think only ten minutes total was when I was bored, so I definitely still really loved this film. And maybe when I rewatch the film the origin won't bother me. Who knows! The film is outstanding though. Ryan Reynolds gives quite possibly the best male acting performance of the year as Wade Wilson/Deadpool. He IS Deadpool. He is absolutely amazing. Morena Baccarin as Vanessa was also great. Everyone in this film did a really good job. The movie is very very funny. There were probably only 1-4 jokes I didn't laugh out loud at. The movie is great. I don't think it's the best of the year, but it is definitely in my top 15 movies of the year. I would give the movie a 9/10.

title: Not quite what I'd hoped.
review:
Though it has been hailed as an original and groundbreaking addition to the superhero universe, I can call this only a step in the right direction. Yeah, it was fun to see a movie that mocked some of the tropes of superhero movies, but aside from that it was mostly LCD entertainment. If nothing else, it was not annoying in the way that superhero movies tend to be. Nobody was miraculously resurrected, and the world was not at stake in any way, which was nice. I think mostly, the creators felt like there should be a super movie that didn't have to cater itself to young audiences. But if you really get down to it, there is very little that is truly original about this movie.

As our anti-hero, Deadpool's main goal is for the audience to have fun and basically love him even as he mutilates bodyguards and special ops left and right. He certainly has a presence and personality, always ready to pull out a sarcastic line regardless of his mood. His relationship with Vanessa was believable and not much more. There are two main problems that I have with his character. First, he believes that Vanessa will not want him back because of his ugliness. This felt like a kind of old-fashioned sentiment that, in other forms, has been used in a number of fairy tales and fairy tale movies like the Frog Prince Shrek. Second, he has too much fun killing people. Now he does have a strong motive for fighting the people he does, but his lighthearted mood in the action scenes is rather heartless.

The other characters don't get too much attention. In fact, they really don't exceed the stereotypes given to them in the opening credits. Francis/Ajax is nothing special in terms of villains; he just has a menacing presence and takes what Wade wants. Colossus is the voice of good to Wade, but gets his advice mercilessly shot down. Vanessa may not be a multi-dimensional character, but she at least has some personality and is not a dreamy airhead like many love-interests.

I was a little disappointed in the comedy that was included. It was funny much of the time and a lot of the jokes felt original, but there just could have been more I guess. Part of the problem was that some of the lines are only funny once and most of them were used in the trailers. Still, there is a lot of variety in the style of humor, which is a major plus and it is presented in entertaining ways. I most enjoyed the budget jokes and Colossus' unfinished hero speech at the end.

If you hate superhero movies, this will be fun for you to see but probably won't be all that you were hoping for. If you like superhero movies, you'll still enjoy this and be able to laugh along with it. For those of you who have doubts, watch the first fifteen minutes and see what you think. As I said, I was a bit disappointed, but if they come out with Deadpool 2, I would be willing to see it. Overall Rating: 8.1/10.

title: Almost a 10/10. Surprisingly the jokes where the downfall
review:
Its true to its comics and that's the best thing about this film.

However the only thing that held this movie back was a lot of culture jokes.

Its essential for people to understand the joke. So you need to use references that majority of the world would know.

And this wasn't the case for this movie, a lot of jokes involved celebrities popular mostly in America. Thus I did not understand the jokes. I understood most of them but imagine some less informed.

The plot wasn't rushed nor too slow.

Actors where fantastic.

Music great.

But overall great movie.

title: Deadpool Is A Winner For Marvel
review:
I have to admit that I am a huge fan of Deadpool. After reading the comics and trades, I was excited when Marvel announced that they were finally going to make a Deadpool movie.

I had liked Ryan Reynolds as Green Lantern but when I found out that he was cast to play Wade Wilson, the merc with a mouth, I was one happy fangirl, and I have to say, he did not disappoint.

Marvel had fun with this film, all the characters were perfectly cast. It was fun watching Negasonic Teenage Warhead (Brianna Hildebrand) interacting with Deadpool, trading snark for snark while Colossus (Stefan Kapičić as the voice of Colossus,) is trying in vain to appeal to Deadpool's (better, saner?) side without success. Ajax and Angel Dust (Ed Skrein and Gina Carano) were good strong villains but it was Leslie Uggams as Blind Al that really stole the movie.

The rest of the supporting cast played their roles well and created a good strong background for the main cast.

It was also nice to see that Marvel finally got Deadpool's character right for a change and I loved the fact that Deadpool's constantly breaking the fourth wall was included and a brief glimpse of Bob popped up to the delight of the audience.

The movie was filled with chaotic images and kept up a frantic pace that suited the movie perfectly. The constant tongue-in-cheek references and humour kept the movie from becoming too dark.

All in all, Deadpool was a winner and I am looking forward to the sequel.

title: The Only Comic based Movie that everyone needs to see
review: So Deadpool , a character which was butchered in X-Men Origins but here he is again taking the stage all by himself.Its so funny ,explicit, humorous and hit all the right chords of an R Rated Comedy about a hero who definitely kills more than villains. Firstly this movie works because of the freedom it received and without any intervention from anyone it does what it should do, it makes you laugh filled with wierdly funny jokes and amazing action sequences.And Ryan Reylonds is absolutely amazingly fantastic. Where was he all those years ago? His portrayal deserves him an Oscar but academy.This film from stating the film's cast and title till the end credtis roll is a full on laughter ride.I mean this is the film that makes fun of the x men timeline and states that's confusing.This is the one that points out that the Xavier's mansion blows up in every x men movie.I will not go further on the story though since you should watch it and be surprised but I can tell you every thing u loved or hated about a superhero movie is being laughed at in this flick.go and watch

title: Worthy Of It's Rating
review:
If you are easily offended than you are probably one of the people that have said this is the worst Marvel movie ever. If you don't actually know anything about Deadpool or even Marvel in general, then you are probably one of the people that gave this movie a one star rating. If your sense of humor is lacking then you won't enjoy this movie.

I see so many people talking about how Deadpool acted like a 13 year old throughout the entire movie. But what is funny to me is the fact that in today's society, 13 year olds are the quickest to be offended by everything. And every negative review brought up the use of the "f word" in this movie. Seriously people, do you not know what an R rating is? Have you not ever seen a Tarantino movie?

In my opinion, if you didn't like this movie, then you know nothing about Deadpool or you decided to hate it before watching it because it was too popular. It's a great movie. Can't think of one flaw.

Bottom line is it's just a hilarious and action packed movie and Ryan Reynolds is great. There are so many "Marvel" fans out there now. Most of which have never picked up a comic book. Not everything out there Marvel related is Captain America and Iron Man. And in case you missed it Deadpool is not a hero. Do more research on what you're about to be watching because if you're a cringer, you should just stick to the cookie-cutter comic book characters. Go get offended by something that's actually offensive...

title: Deadpool is A Great movie!
review: i think dead pool is a great movie and i would rate it 10 out of 10. i say this because it has tons of humorous action in this film, but also it shows you what different acts people can make towards trying to make its viewers laugh.Even though it may not be for younger audiences, it shows you how life can turn from very good... to crap, but just because some medical things happen, doesn't stop you from trying to change the world before your gone.I think that if you enjoy comic book humor, and kind of dirty minded films, this is exactly for someone like you. I Enjoy it myself because it is kind of perverted yes, but it has so much humor, and it shows you how bad life can really be for some people. these are some reasons of why i would rate Deadpool a 10 out of 10 movie.

title: THE Absolute Best of the Marvel Bunch
review:
A highly enjoyable balls to the wall comedy action flick that knows exactly what it is and never takes itself too seriously. For me Marvel comics has created many of the best and most watchable blockbusters on the market right now and this does not disappoint.

Extremely sarcastic and willing to poke fun at other Marvel characters and even the actors who play them which makes for a superb look at deadpool and his anti-hero mentality. Ryan Reynolds is absolutely perfect for this role and simply no other actor could play this part with such ease and confidence the way Ryan does.

Jokes land and are laugh out loud, the action sequences are excellently done with comedy even thrown in and the story keeps you thoroughly entertained throughout.

Overall a completely unique and refreshing look at the 'hero' genre and a mixture of original comedy, action and good old bad ass fun.

title: A bit over hyped, but still awesome
review:
There rarely exists a time when i actually like a superhero movie. But Deadpool is an exception, in the way that it's different from most superhero movies.

Now, i tried not to join the hype train in fear of disappointment. But fortunately, i was not disappointed in the slightest.

Apart from that, Deadpool has lived up to everyone's expectations. And most definitely has surpassed mine. At first i thought it was going to be another bland superhero movie with little to no backstory of the main character. But boy was i wrong. Surprisingly there was a enough of the story to make me feel emotionally attached to this character.

And of course, there are things being exploded, balls being busted, and above all awesomeness.

If your like potty jokes and awesomeness in general, than what are you waiting for? Go watch it!

title: Deadpool Review
review: Deadpool(2016) Starring: Ryan Reynolds, Morena Baccarin, Gina Carano, T.J. Miller, Ed Skrein, Brianna Hildebrand, Jed Ress, and Karan Soni Directed By: Tim Miller Review You know I didn't think I was going to see this movie because while I may be eighteen I have no I.D but luckily my father took me. Man I'm glad cause this is one of the best superhero films! Just not the best R-Rated one. Based upon Marvel Comics' most unconventional anti-hero, DEADPOOL tells the origin story of former Special Forces operative turned mercenary Wade Wilson, who after being subjected to a rogue experiment that leaves him with accelerated healing powers, adopts the alter ego Deadpool. Armed with his new abilities and a dark, twisted sense of humor, Deadpool hunts down the man who nearly destroyed his life. This is a comic book that does not acknowledge itself but damn as heck feels like one with his balls out their humor and crazy costumed hero. This movie was trying to get off the ground for years by Ryan Reynolds who felt he owed it to fans of the character to give them the Deadpool they wanted after relentless backlash for both X-Men:Origins Wolverine and his Green Lantern movie. He damn well did owe us and he delivered. It may be the most fun I have had in a comic book movie but that doesn't automatically make it the best, but it's one of the best, not better than two films I could mention but the point is that you will fall in love with Deadpool.

title: The funniest, non-cliché and superior superhero movie I've ever seen...
review: The funniest, non-cliché and superior superhero movie I've ever seen... As a character, Deadpool is unlike any "hero" you've ever seen.He has no qualms with blowing a bad guys head off with his pair of nine- millimeter pistols or cutting them off with his twin katanas, he's mixing it up with both the on-screen baddies and the audience.A superhero film is only as good as the actor playing him and, if ever an actor was meant to play Deadpool, it is Ryan Reynolds.Ryan Reynolds, the king of charming smartness, hits the big time.But it's undeniably true that I'm in the minority here, as Reynolds has never been able to break through with audiences in a real or enduring way. Every effort to turn him into a legit action star has been met with stony silence, if not open contempt.

title: The best superhero movie / movie I have seen.
review:
I gave it 9,cause I am keeping 10 saved for when the finally gets the budget to ONLY get slightly better editors for the action sequences.But really,the action sequences are etched in your memory.The graphic scenes are etched in your memory.This movie is Deadpool having so much fun while being so sadly tragic that I CANNOT BELIEVE HOW CAN ANYBODY NOT LIKE THIS MOVIE .This is the best superhero movie I have seen,best romantic , twisted humor, movie I have seen,and it is a really good love story. I mean I am a bit surprised.Deadpool is so memorable he is better than goddamn tony stark without the suit.Yes I will go that far.Ironman can suck it.

This movie has so many inside gags on the whole super hero franchise,that I do not know how they will top it in any further franchise.That worries me.This is a cult classic.I am trying really hard not to give spoilers.

The jokes are hilarious,not because Deadpool is a stand up comedian but simply cause his life is so tragic,and you cannot help laughing with him.It is a very satisfying experience to watch if you like gore,they have well thought out sequences that just hit you right in the cringe-worthy satisfying sympathy for the guy.The movie plot is so pointless and so satisfying cause it has nothing got to do with saving anyone but simply this guy's own personal vendetta/pointless vanity effort to fix his pointless life.He is such a romantic.The whole premise of this movie is so romantic. And so cheesy.And so irritatingly pointless.The sidekicks in this movie are well thought out,and while Deadpool steals the show,the others just add the right mix of hilarious sweetness to this.This is the best gangster movie/super hero movie/passably romantic movie/a memorable movie I have seen.

I think I have made it clear I adore this film.If anything I would like to have changed in this movie is that while the action sequences are so,so satisfyingly delicious,I would have liked the editing of only those sequences to have been better.

I love Deadpool.He has pointless super powers and I don't even care.I love him.Hearts.How are you guys ever gonna top this.I like him better than Ironman and Batman.But seriously how will you top this?I go and check Deadpool's actor Ryan Reynold's google page which points out his spouse to be Blake Lively,and an ex to be Scarlet Johansson.Ryan,you dog.And you are green Lantern and Deadpool.I love you.New fan.

Though,don't watch this if you are under 18.And,it is really bad as a friendly superhero movie for the family,I should point that out.Your kids will not dress up as Deadpool the way they dress up for other superheros,it would be wrong.Yes that is about it.

title: Not your average Disney superhero film
review:
The new age of superhero movies shows how meta references and involving an expanding world of superheroes can create an entertaining flick.

Deadpool isn't an average hero who has noble intentions or wants to save the world for the right reasons.

Deadpool is in it for the revenge and to make something out of his worthless life. I saw bravery and true potential from him in the start when he was willing to risk his life for a girl who's boyfriend wouldn't leave her alone. Most wouldn't care or get involved.

He undergoes experiments to transform his body into a super mutant, but instead is betrayed by the mad scientist to become a slave.

While in not usually a fan of self aware films that pretend to be intelligent or witty yet this turned out to be a hidden gem.

Ryan Reynolds has come along way from being a pretty face and a one note actor to be a leading man. He brought heart and conviction to this role.

The xmen extras felt a little phony and not true to form of the characters we seen portrayed in the xmen series. Yet I found a certain appeal in their willfulness to risk livelihood and loved ones for the greater good.

The leading lady willing to over look psychical beauty for the man inside was touching. She didn't care what anyone thought or how strange they looked in public. You don't get depth like that in super hero movie or kick-ass.

Still it leaves the question on if Deadpool is gay, straight or bi since some of the action or phases he sprouts are questionable about his sexuality.

The final fight scene was magnificent and kept you guessing. Will he save the girl or let her go to save mankind. It was heartbreaking, funny and touching.

It earned all ten stars. Don't be put off commercials that don't do It justice.

title: DEADPOOL = how can people really hate this movie?
review: I understand it could of done better however, loads of people rated this 1 star out of 10. Have you frigging seen the opening credits. That was awesome. I mean "starring God's Perfect Idiot". That is awesome. The cast was amazing, the flashbacks were good and this film had some funny jokes. If you are over the age of 15 and have not seen DEADPOOL, i assure you, go and watch it. This film was awesome. Tim Miller, Ryan Reynolds and much more help from loads of people made this film for a long time. IT WAS WORTH IT. Colossus was amazing in this. Negasonic Teenage Warhead was brilliant. And the damn British VILLAIN was outstanding. I don't understand how anyone can really hate this. This was a good success!

title: Brilliant Superhero comedy
review: Ryan Reynolds demeanor is perfect for this role. The movie is an excellent blend of action, humor, and excitement! It catches you from the start and holds your attention throughout. The special effects are great. The flow of the movie jumps around a bit but is done properly and conforms to the story. References to the X Men may suggest a possible merge of characters from this movie in the future. I think that would be an amazing addition to the X Men genre as it would bring the Deadpool humor into that series. However that would also have possible effect on the ratings, or they would have to tone down the Deadpool character in the movie or at least limit his appearances to avoid the crudeness and violence that would give it the "R" rating... As the warnings have stated... this is not for children!

title: the Mockumentary style of the Merc with the Mouth: Killed it.
review:
OK, it was an origin story - again. I don't know how many more super hero movies - Especially origin stories - I can take.

But this one killed it, and for a couple different reasons: First of all, it was fun, funny, sexy, and almost gratuitously violent (hey, I'm a North American movie watcher, I like those as much as the next guy.) I found their approach to sexuality hilarious - one nice big montage, get all that super steamy sex out of the way, so that Boom we can go back to the plot.

The violence was great - I thought they could have done more to establish the fact that Wade Wilson was a badass apex-fighter Pre healing factor, or shown some training montages after his powers, or Something to justify his triple-sow-cow aerial-marksmen maneuvers (lol) and I thought the fight between him and Francis at the end would have been more realistic if Francis (who had enhanced reflexes) took less hits, while Wade (with normal, albeit "Peak" reflexes) just kept taking hit after hit but wearing Francis down gradually. Aside from that though, Epic fighting and I loved it.

But finally, I think part of the reason it was a success was the Mockumentary style - like The Office - of Wade constantly breaking the fourth wall (like in the comic book). It was hilarious, and added new levels of humour: it also allowed the character to comment ironically on himself and his situation, and connect with the audience in a new way through that. The lines themselves were funny too, and the delivery excellent, but the 'Mockumentary' fourth wall style turned out to be super conducive to getting viewers to connect with the character (which is particularly important given his anti hero status - we forgive Wade for a lot because of his brief asides to us.) Excellent flick, highly entertaining. One of my favourite lines was when Wade is talking about being good looking, and asks "Do you think Ryan Reynolds got by on his 'acting method'?" I thought that was hilarious - and then watched as the same Ryan gave an excellent performance while looking like a diseased avocado. Well done ol' boy.

title: Potential Spoilers : Arguing with people who gave it 1 star
review:
I'm only writing this review to argue with those who gave it 1 star. What the f*** is wrong with you. Sure it wasn't the best movie ever made but it deserved at least a 6. And the reasons you gave were not all valid like :

1. Deadpool thinks he's a stand up comedian even though "his jokes are not funny" - That's who he is, if he didn't spit out some lame and pointless jokes every ones in a while than he wouldn't have been a good Deadpool now would he.

2. The villains' intentions are not clear : Yes they are, as Francis clearly states that they were going to give Wade super Xmen powers, and create the deadpool version from Wolverine origins, so brainwash and use him however they want to.

3. Women Worship bs - Of coarse the chick had to save the day. The movie was released on Valentines day and a ton of girlfriends were forced to watch the movie at the theaters (or secretly wanted anyway because of Ryan Reynolds).

4. For whoever said that deadpool isn't funny because it's not quotable, You're gonna die... in 5 minutes :P

(I only used an arrogant tone + swear words because it's a deadpool review. I actually respect your opinions and all, so I'd like to apologize about that)

title: Don't listen to the one star reviews this movie is awesome
review: Vile, offensive and insane with no redeeming social value at all. In other words; IT WAS AWESOME!!!!! Deadpool is what happens when you take the usual superhero movie, mix it with an antihero drama and then decide to make it an action comedy. The movie is super meta with vile language and adult situations so this is not for the littles. This is one of Ryan Reynolds better movies but that isn't exactly a ringing endorsement. This is less a superhero movie and more a revenge fantasy that becomes a twisted love story somewhere along the way. Not for the faint of heart, anyone with a low tolerance for vulgarity or for anyone who takes superhero movies seriously. This is fun and vulgar and funny vulgar but it doesn't pretend to be anything else

title: A fun movie, unless you hate the style of character and a simple story.
review: So, I took a look at the reviews and I found something. Most of the low ratings are complaining about Deadpool talking too much, the lack of using the budget to put more X-Men in the film, and the clichéd and predictable plot. Well, I have one thing to say to all of those people: read a Deadpool comic. His character is supposed to be talking all the time, making fourth wall jokes, and overall, being as raunchy and inappropriate as he can. That's his character, and it was pulled off perfectly. The plot was simple, but that was the point. It wasn't supposed to be this deep, thought-provoking movie. This was supposed to be a fun rendition of the Merc with a Mouth. And with the action in this film, it was a great one. This movie was a fun ride with plenty of jokes, and a few somber moments sprinkled in there. But if you don't like raunchy humor at all, if you're not a fan of the main character not believing there even is a fourth wall, if you don't like the way the character is supposed to be or a simple and fun movie, then this isn't for you. Otherwise, buy this movie, because you will love it.

title: yes its stupid but its enjoyable
review:
If you compare this to other DC and Marvel films Deadpool is not an outstanding film yes it does have some scenes that are Offinece and rude and Racist but its not that bad of for an anti hero film here are some of the things that I did and did not like about this film. 1. some scenes are rather inaporepet at times which could of been cut out of the film and be an bonus feather on the DVD and Blu ray release. 2. I think the film is a bit overrated giving it an 8.2 on IMDb I think at least give it an 7.3 instead just because some of the sexual scenes are a bit too much.

I do like this movie as it is one of my favorite SCIF but The sex scenes where a bit too much

overall its a great film if you don't take it too seriously 7/10

title: Great movie! New type of Superhero movies
review: Deadpool is a great marvel film, some say it's the best some say it's not, this is my opinion. Deadpool has good comedy en well directed action and dialogue between a handful of interesting characters which most of have important value to the story. ALso CGI is well incorporated with the movie/story. Those where some positive points, the negative point is that the movie makes a lot of jokes about Cliché superhero story's, but DeadPool has quite a cliché story itself. Still great movie. IMDb makes me have 10 lines so let us write random words film cheese Deadpool marvel coockie space sword line IMDb we are almost done with writing stupid lines almost come on this takes for ever thanks for reading my review on DeadPool.

title: Death serious. Deadpool is absolutely to die for. Dead on.
review:
You're probably thinking, "my boyfriend said this was a superhero movie but that guy in the red suit just turned that other guy into a f*cking kebab!" Well, I may be super. But I'm no hero.

Despite the feeling of satiety when it comes to superhero movies, I still had to see this new hero from the Marvel stable. Now, you didn't need much to persuade me to watch it. Certainly not after I saw the revealed trailer last year. Immediately I was convinced that this could become a mega blockbuster. It was so brilliant and witty. Trust me, I was sick and tired of the world of The Avengers, X-Men and Super/Spiderman. Besides "Guardians of the Galaxy" and "Ant-Man", most superhero movies were just a copy from the previous episodes. Another story-line but with the same principle. "Guardians of the Galaxy", "Ant-Man" and "Deadpool" are an exception to that rule. A refreshing breeze through the superheroes universe.

Right from the opening credits you know what to expect. A mixture of bluntly, spectacular action and sharp, unabashed humor. "Deadpool" is "some douche-bag's film" and as protagonist "God's perfect idiot" with "a hot chick" to take revenge on "a British villain" with the help of "a moody teen" and "a CGI character". Produced by "asshats", written by "the real heroes here" and directed by "an overpaid tool". You can read this during the opening shot with the camera zooming out in slow motion during a devastating car-crash. Maybe it's not high-level humor, but it's an indication that you shouldn't take it all seriously. A crossfire of sarcastic, sexual and provocative one-liners throughout the whole film. Deadpool is an outsider at all levels who uses both self-deprecating and offensive text lines. The humor is sometimes as explicit as the violence used in the movie. Graphic violence with well thought sarcasm is exactly the combination I love the most.

Ryan Reynolds could drop his acting talent, since he wears the Deadpool mask practically the entire movie. I have no doubts about his abilities as an actor. Certainly not after seeing him in "Mississippi Grind" and "Woman in Gold". The mediocre movies in which he turned up ("RIPD", "Safe House" and "Green Lantern") were from a significantly lower level. But this was certainly not due to Reynolds, but rather because of a measly movie script. In "Deadpool" physical stamina, agility and speaking skills are more important than acting skills. His greatest merit is his perseverance to get this Deadpool project realized, despite the resistance of the Marvel despots. After a cameo in "X-Men Origins: Wolverine", his obstinacy and the enthusiasm of the Deadpool-supporters made sure this film was realized. Thank God for that!

I include this highly entertaining and over-the-top movie in the list of most successful movies of the year. For all I care they can think up a few sequels, even though I thoroughly hate sequels. As long as the concept stays intact and both humor and action are of an equivalent level. "Deadpool" fascinated me so much, that even the presence of Gina Carano didn't bother me. Ed Skrein showed again that he's cut out for a role as crazy villain and that participating in a monstrosity as "The transporter refueled" was a misjudgment. One thing is clear though. Haven't you seen this flick? Put on a red latex suit, place yourself in front of a widescreen television and have fun with this unpretentious, anti-hero.

More reviews here : http://bit.ly/1KIdQMT

title: Surprisingly, I loved it!!!
review:
I avoided this movie when it was in the theaters, but recently I was on a long haul flight and watched this movie. I thought I would probably give up on it after 30 minutes and move on to another selection! This isn't the sort of movie I would normally watch but I'm so glad that I did. Ryan Reynolds played his part beautifully - he's good in comedy, I love his dry sense of humor!! The special effects were spectacular, and there was a reasonable story-line to follow. I was enthralled from start to finish. One minor criticism - the overuse of bad language - had it been used less it would have been more effective and have more impact.

If you're like me and avoid all kind of superhero movies, give this one a go. It really is better than you probably imagine. The consistent foul language is a bit of turn off, but apart from that, it's an enjoyable spoof and send up of this genre. I have no hesitation recommending this movie.

title: the best movie I've seen in ages! hilarious! this is all Ryan Renolds.
review:
An ex special forces mercenary who finds love is diagnosed with cancer and out of desperation to live with his new found love, accepts an offer in a dodgy experiment to become a mutant with super healing powers to cure his illness but the price is literally hideous and atrociously torturous so Deadpool is born and he sets out on a rampage for revenge on the people who so deceitfully made him the thing he has become.

Anyone who doesn't like this movie has a very dismal sense of humour. It's so hilarious and Ryan Renolds gets let lose in his hilarity in this. This part is made for him like iron man for Robert Downey Jr. It is much more violent and explicit than the usual Xmen franchise but it's part of the entertainment for Deadpool is no hero nor a bad guy either. I found myself crying with laughter. This is such an off beat unpredictable movie. I loved it. Not for kids folks. That's for sure. Another fantastic Marvel flick!!

title: Maybe too much hype?
review:
Though this movie was good, and I gave it a 8 doesn't mean I fully liked it. As a lot of people have mentioned "deadpool" is going to be the most(badass) movie coming and it will be so hilarious". Regardless of the nasty sexual humor in the movie, I think it still missed some spice to be a "great" movie. I actually liked how it was built to be a cliché with the bad guys with bad guys versus good guys that might not be that good after all.

In a nutshell, a nice movie with too much hype. The music in the movie added a really nice input since it was planned well with the scenes :). The movie was easy to watch and it was something that I didn't really need to fully pay attention to. I actually multi tasked while watching and I still stayed aware of what happened.

I recommend you to watch the movie though if you haven't yet. It's nowadays a good thing to know what the movie was like because after all it is quite popular!

title: Good Movie But Could Have Been Better
review: Was A pretty good movie. Just wish the studios would make up their minds about how they want the characters to look like and keep it they way and at the same time keep it close to the original comic character as possible. First The had him in Wolverine with swords as arms, too funny. I mean when did Colossus become Russian? And think they could have picked a better known x-men other than "Negasonic" to be in it. I hope they get it right in the squeal. But over all was a decent movie. Just sucks that its rated R for people with kids who like X-Men. And Wolverine 3 is supposed to be rated R also. Kids are gonna be disappointed again.And they need to stop messing around and make a movie about Gambit!!!

title: Deadpool is about a mercenary who goes thru hell to save his life to spend the rest of his life with his wife.
review: I am writing a review for most likely, one of the best movies of all time, Deadpool. First I would like to discuss the plot of this movie. The plot of this movie is a mercenary who meets a beautiful women falls in love, leaves the business of killing people and right when everything is going well he gets news that he has cancer that will more than likely kill him. So as he is sitting in the bar having a couple drinks contemplating his situation he gets offered a way of getting his cancer cured but in exchange he becomes a test subject that will make him appear as a freak but have powers of a mutant. After he gets free after he puts the facility on fire he search down for the man who tortured him for months and at the end he ends up finding him but only at the cost of his wife being kidnapped. There does end up being a happy ending and Deadpool considers joining the X- Men. Now although the ending is no different from most super hero endings I still was extremely connected to the plot and I don't even know why. The humor aspect of it was also very good the whole time I was watching the movie I was literally dying of laughter. This is why I gave this movie a 9/10 and if the director is seeing this keep up the good work.

title: Every Bit as Vile, Profane and Gratuitous as it Needed to Be
review: Just the kind of fresh blood this genre needed. Superhero films (and modern pop culture at large, really) have been ripe for satire for some time now, and Deadpool is a great vehicle for bringing that about without feeling disingenuous or trashing the original character along the way. The first hour is basically one long dose of fan service, sharp and egregious with both wit and weaponry. The seams show through in a lot of the CGI, but that just plays into the act and, in a way, adds to the film's clunky, DIY charm. Ryan Reynolds is really what makes the whole thing work, both on-screen and off, as he occupies the character with uncanny zeal and was instrumental in bringing the mercenary back from Xavier's junkyard. We stop short of the unhinged, deranged depths of disconnected insanity that typify Deadpool's comic book persona, and the closing act / happy ending feels force-fed, but that seems like a small price to pay. Otherwise, it's effective at becoming what it set out to be: a chaotic, gratuitous, shoot-from-the-hip misadventure that blows stuff up, decapitates bad guys and takes every opportunity to squeeze in a literal wink and nod at the viewing audience. I had a ball.

title: The perfect example of what happen when you listen to the fans
review:
I really enjoyed Deadpool because it is my kind of humor and the great thing about Deadpool is that he kind of breaks the 4th wall and that is just amazing i think.

Deadpool is about a guy (Wade Wilson) who have found love and suddenly out of nowhere gets cancer and he doesn't know what to do. Some guy says he can help and cure him and leaves a card with a phone number on. Wade then calls the number and ends up on an operation table in a underground lab. They make him into someone special. They say he can not leave and that he have to work for them. Wade escapes and sets out on a journey to hunt them down to make sure his loved ones is safe. Ryan Reynolds is the PERFECT actor for Deadpool i don think there is any other actor that could have pulled it off. Ryan is Deadpool. Deadpool is Ryan. Morena Baccarin is a beautiful actor and a great actor for the part. I don't think there is any of the actors in this movie that did not do a great job on their role.

The shooting and directing was great! when i look at the cinematography in movies and series i compare them to The Blacklist because The Blacklist i think does it all perfect and Deadpool was close i think to the same level. The lighting was good as well and I don't think there was any scenes in the movie that didn't have good lighting.

The music was awesome! every song was so fitting to the scenes.

I am rating this 9/10 because it was everything i looked for in a movie about Deadpool

I am not giving it 10/10 because there are very few movies worth giving 10/10 and i don't want to give it away to everything.

title: Funniest movie I've seen in ages
review:
When Deadpool was announced and the first trailer started to roll, I was hugely hyped since there were no other actor other than Ryan Reynolds that I could think of portraying him. I still remember the filthy mouthed guy that struck me in Blade 3 with his "f**k me sideways" line. And the trailer was so promising that I started to have doubts, if the rest of the movie could be as funny and raw as the trailer. These days you watch so many trailers that are better than the whole movie, so I had my concerns.

So, I went to see Deadpool when it premiered and, boy, was I blown away from the first second. This movie brilliantly gets right in the middle of the plot, during the action and flashes back and forth, making the viewing of the movie interesting and does not bore you for a second. I knew that the Merc with the mouth was a filthy, filthy mouthed anti-hero, but the level of profanity and foul language is so high and disgusting that I am amazed that high executives gave the green light for such a blockbuster. I won't go into many details, but the movie is extremely funny and raw, with so many dick jokes as anyone can handle, but at the same time is very sweet and tender. It is actually a love story clothed with explosive action and sick humor. It is very well directed, with the proper pace, it takes the time to let you know about the protagonist, it doesn't take things for granted, nor does it demand that you should have read a million comic books in order to "get it". It provides the back story with a great back and forth movement. It, also, has so many easter eggs that it would probably require another 2-hour movie to analyze everything.

So to wrap it up, this is a hilarious movie, with the best casting decision for a superhero, equally awesome as Robert Downey Jr., who nailed Iron Man and became an immortal god. Now, if you are easily offended, hate the foul language and the occasional butt plugging of Reynolds, then you should probably pass. If you want to see a thought provoking movie go and rent Primer. If you have kids and want to go to see the movie, good for you, you're an awesome parent. But be AWARE, in this movie some things cannot be unseen, so if you fall in the above category of easily offended people, you enter at your own risk.

title: Brilliantly pulled off
review: When this movie was announced I was a sceptic as to weather they could pull it off, and I'm glad they did manage to pull it off. The jokes are funny and are made funnier by the delivery. I could not imagine another actor other than Ryan Reynolds playing Deadpool, he was a brilliant choice. The film was completed with his voice and charm as he managed to break the fourth wall excellently, the best use of breaking the fourth wall that I have seen in any other film or play.Yet I felt towards the end of the movie that they lost the charm that was with the movie to begin with and it ended rather abruptly. I understand that it had to come to an end, I just would have preferred a funnier ending. The film over all was beautifully played, I'm just nit-picking over the ending.

title: The Real Deadpool!
review:
Okay, everyone knows of the god awful "film that shall not be named" that sealed the Merc with the Mouth's mouth, right?

Well, Deadpool destroys that movie's Deadpool to kingdom come!

Deadpool is a crazy, deadly, hilarious, crazy, 4th wall breaking, dirty talking, crazy, mercenary who kicks bad (and sometimes good guys) to get what he wants. And that's exactly what we got!

Ryan Reynolds is as much Deadpool as Hugh Jackman is the Wolverine, Robert Downey Junior is Iron Man. Reynolds and the rest of the cast had brilliant and hilarious moments.

Not to mention the marketing team did an amazing job purely showing what Deadpool would do if he was in the world.

If you have a friend/wife/sister/aunt/grandma (okay maybe not grandma) and they're girls, tell her Ryan Reynolds is in it, women, including me, love this movie.

Note: Don't take kids under 12, they'll say "don't worry, it's just a Marvel movie", it's rated MA in Australia and R for the rest of the world.

title: A shot to the heart of the boring comic heroes.
review:
Well it's about time.

For so many years we've suffered through the moralising of Batman, Superman and any number of X-Men (or women), oh and don't get me started on Spiderman and his "with great power comes great responsibility" waffle. They're all so anxious, obnoxious and tedious.

But now we have Deadpool.

Here's a superhero I can get behind (not the same way his girlfriend gets behind him. not that there's anything wrong with that) he's a dude who fights the bad guys the way they fight. Nasty! How many times have we seen Superman smash a baddie and stop short of killing the guy to hand him over to the authorities just for said villain to escape again? Deadpool doesn't suffer from such niceties as justice or compassion. He shoots first and asks questions later. Much later. Like the next day while the coroner is sifting through the remains.

Deadpool is a guy who just gets the job done and doesn't need to moan about it to his butler, in his billion dollar mansion while two supermodels polish his furniture. In fact his alter-ego Wade Wilson lives in a fairly spartan apartment with a blind woman for company and what seems to be a cache of weapons and ammunition big enough to take down ISIS? He's a blue-collar-down-to-earth former soldier with outstanding recuperative skills thanks to a recent brush with a mad scientist. Not "crazy" mad, "angry" mad at Wade!

Ryan Reynolds was born for this role. He's funny AND annoying which is huge improvement on his Green Lantern effort where he was just annoying. His co-stars are just along for the ride which is wildly violent, extremely crude and so unlike every other superhero film it's an instant classic.

Not a kids film or a date film (unless your girlfriend recommends it, in which case go.. then marry her on the way home).

title: extremely funny, amusing, violent ,exciting and stupid
review:
SPOILERS

The director makes his point(that the movie is pointless , stupid but extremely amusing and entertaining clear from the very beginning.) He aims at creating an uncut action hero movie with smart dialogs, good acting along bitter humor and he hits it. He took the risk and tried to avoid the basic structure of hero movies (that have so intensely inundated the cinema that it is hard to differentiate them from each other). The story-telling is good , it keeps the audience interested but still it seemed that the first part of the movie is a bit long, it would be better to stick to present story earlier and intricate it more(the movie overall appeared a little bit short for me).

Here's a summary for the plot, Ryan Reynolds is a former mercenary with a loving girlfriend who is diagnosed by cancer and while searching for a cure, he becomes a victim of an evil scientist"s experiment , leaving him disfigured with supernatural healing powers. He becomes a superhero and decides to revenge, the plot is easy to grasp and the way it is told keeps audience engaged and amused(though at the end it gets too predictable , waited for more unique one).

Deadpool brings one of the most hilarious fictional character from marvel's universe to life, in a really unique way. The humor is refreshing and funny (waited more about the taxi drive at the end), the dialogs are smart and many scenes are amusing along with being brutal, violent and sexy ( A fairly R rated movie.) soundtracks are pretty decent and enjoyable. The action scenes were incredibly well done (with just 55million budget , which is almost 1/4 of typical hero movies) with a lot of beautifully elaborated details. Reynolds is incredible as Deadpool, he fits the character really well. The great chemistry he has with co-star Morena Baccarin gives a good emotional core to the movie and eventually surprises audience by the love story that is one the most honest I've ever seen in a superhero movie .

So, Deadpool is a decent comedy, action , hero-movie that offers audience a smart humor, dirty sexual scenes, violence, well-crafted action scenes and amusing story- telling that will probably make you feel engaged and entertained for 2 hours.

title: A comic fan of a ways backs' view
review:
Let me first say I've never read a Deadpool comic. I did however read enough to give his character some background so I wasn't going in blind.

The upside is this movie is accessible to even those who go in blind. It doesn't pull any punches though or try to soften the character, or try to be anything but a great action flick with lots of inappropriate humor. Lucky for me I love that kind of humor.

The only complaint I can say I have of the film and Im not even saying its a huge complaint. More like a minor nuisance. Was the pacing. It felt like it jumped back and forth a bit too much, not in a hard to follow way. Just in a lets progress the plot and not keep going back sort of way.

Other then that, I cant say there's anything Id have changed. Fight scenes were amazing. Acting was imo great, music felt like it fit the movie rather then a studio trying to push an album, camera work and lighting were well done.

This movies not going to win any Oscars(sadly) but it shows what a violent super hero movie can be.(would love to see the next Wolverine movie go this route) Some are saying Kick Ass was better, having seen both films, I appreciate what both brought to the table. Not knocking one or the other. If I had to say this movie was comparable to anything else I'd say a mash-up of Kingsman meets Kick Ass.

I want to say so much about the plot but wont ruin it for anyone. Lastly Ill just ad that this is the first super hero movie I've written a review for. I've seen Watchmen, Batman(all of them), Superman(almost all of them?), X everything, and am looking forward to seeing both Suicide Squad and Batman vs. Superman.

I'm not a DC or a Marvel, I'm a comic/movie lover. If you have questions feel free to ask me. If there are any spoilers I'll use the spoiler block so as not to ruin it for anyone.

Sorry for my all over the place review. Hope this sheds some light for those who are wanting to see it. I only gave it an 8 because 9 and 10 are at least for me more for movies that are powerful emotionally as well.

title: A true trailblazer and trend-setter for comic book movies
review:
DEADPOOL. He finally gets his movie. After a laughable appearance in the groan inducing X-MEN ORIGINS: WOLVERINE, Ryan Reynolds is back bringing Wade Wilson, The Merc With a Mouth, The Regenerating Degenerate (and a whole paragraph of other monikers), to the big screen with what is possibly the most faithful portrayal of a comic book character to date in live action.

I watch this and I am convinced that Ryan Reynolds has never existed. He has always been Wade Wilson deep down inside and this movie is Deadpool showing up his true self. He is perfect. Exactly like the more comedic Deadpool of recent years but with enough of the bad ass 1990s Deadpool so as not to come across like any other lovable loser. Read the comic, watch the movie, play the game, whatever, it will be the exact same character you know and love.

DEADPOOL kicks off with One of the most uniquely imaginative, Tongue-in-cheek opening sequences to over grace the silver screen. (Keep Wikipedia and a counter handy for all the pop culture references). The movie defies genre, it defies convention, it throws us right into the thick of the action. Unlike many comic book character origin stories, we do not get bogged down by a lengthy first act setting up the eventual "birth" of the superhero, where the titular character is only seen in his civilian self without powers or the iconic costumes. For the obligatory tragic backstory, we get flash backs interspersed with the ongoing altercations. Just as the flashback looks like it will start to drag, we are snapped right back into the whizzing bullets, blood and twin blade action.

The overall plot is a little bit derivative but in this day and age with eons of creative history behind movie making, what else isn't? It is the execution, the energy instilled by director Tim Miller, and the well timed, well written, clever humour soaked into the script by Writers Rhett Reese and Paul Wernick of ZOMBIELAND fame. We aren't talking the cartoony quips or snide banter of Disney's Marvel movies.
